DOC.brief_summary: To study identify sequence alteration occur chorioretinal interface progression AMD `` dry '' AMD sight-threatening chorioretinal neovascularization ( CNV ) .
DOC.detailed_description: The primary statistical objective study identify sequence alteration occur chorioretinal interface progression AMD risk `` dry '' AMD sight-threatening chorioretinal neovascularization ( CNV ) ( wet AMD ) . Different image method use simultaneously regular interval order characterize marker predictor conversion sight-threatening CNV : CNV ( classic occult ) position CNV within 2500 µm ( ~1.7 disc diameter ) foveal center , evidence fluorescein angiography . This institutional , prospective , observation study perform fellow eye patient evidence `` wet '' AMD eye . Therefore , patient evidence exudative ( `` wet '' ) AMD one eye ( non-study eye ) non-exudative ( `` dry '' ) AMD fellow eye ( study eye ) risk progressive exudation `` wet '' CNV . Patients exit study time develop sight-threatening CNV study eye treat discretion physician .
DOC.criteria: Written inform consent Age 50 year Any race sex Clinical diagnosis exudative AM ; D one eye ( nonstud eye ) presence follow characteristic second eye ( study eye , eye treat ) : At least 5 intermediate ( > 63 µm ) large soft drusen AND/OR Confluent drusen within 3000 µm fovea center Hyperpigmentation History medical condition would preclude schedule study visit History ophthalmic disease study eye AMD Clinical sign myopic retinopathy , refraction high 8 diopter power .
